text: <@U0GN0A9EV>, you mentioned you had some printing connects previously, right? do they have a website? just curious on what their capabilities are to keep in the back of our minds while we think of content.
<@U02AUNA0P>- from the conversations I've heard, I think people were leaning towards in-house printing, but can circle back on that if Ivan doesn't have a definite answer
interesting. that kind of changes things too. who were involved in these conversations out of curiosity?
The Welcome Kit team. A dynamic group, but Ewald, Ivan, Ally, Leah
I imagine they could be persuaded to go in a different direction, but I believe the original thinking went that a cool, zine aesthetic was not only "on brand", but was economic
were there talk on how many we need/want to produce?

just worried about production time + quality if we keep it in-house, because the phaser doesn't output the best prints, and the epson is fine quality wise, but is slow and doesn't print double-sided too.
I think there was an idea of procuring a specific machine for the task. Not quite full magazine quality, but better than what we currently have.
oh cool, was a “risograph” ever brought up in conversations out of curiosity? :eyes:
:grin: I never heard it, but may just not have retained it
lol damn, was hoping that'd ring a bell
It wouldn't be very economical to use the epson unless it was a really small run. It's slow, the ink is expensive, and we'd need to spend a good amount of production time cutting and folding.
Yeah. I think a persuasive case could be made for another approach
Probably something we need Ewald to be at right?
If not, can we move from Monday to Friday. I got tons of runway Friday, while Monday is pretty packed
Ewald wants to be informed but not necessarily involved
can you invite ali to that meeting too?
Yeah. I was thinking more because it was about funding (e.g. printing) and previously, the sentiment had been very much stirred toward in-house printing, but Phillip has brought up some questions
